com.thinkaurelius.titan.diskstorage.keycolumnvalue

Class StandardStoreFeatures

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.thinkaurelius.titan.diskstorage.keycolumnvalue.StandardStoreFeatures
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    StoreFeatures

    public class StandardStoreFeatures
extends Object
implements StoreFeatures
    Immutable, StandardStoreFeatures.Builder-customizable implementation of StoreFeatures.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      static class  StandardStoreFeatures.Builder
      The only way to instantiate StandardStoreFeatures.

      Equivalent to calling StoreFeatures.hasUnorderedScan() || StoreFeatures.hasOrderedScan().

      Returns true if this storage backend supports time-to-live (TTL) settings on a per-store basis.

      boolean hasVisibility()
      Returns true if this storage backend supports entry-level visibility by attaching a visibility or authentication token to each column-value entry in the data store and limited retrievals to "visible" entries.
      boolean isDistributed()
      Whether this storage backend writes and reads data from more than one machine.
      boolean isKeyConsistent()
      Whether this storage backend provides strong consistency within each key/row.

      • isKeyConsistent

        public boolean isKeyConsistent()
        Description copied from interface: StoreFeatures
        Whether this storage backend provides strong consistency within each key/row. This property is weaker than general strong consistency, since reads and writes to different keys need not obey strong consistency. "Key consistency" is shorthand for "strong consistency at the key/row level".
        Specified by:
        isKeyConsistent in interface StoreFeatures
        Returns:
        true if the backend supports key-level strong consistency

      • hasTimestamps

        public boolean hasTimestamps()
        Description copied from interface: StoreFeatures
        Returns true if column-value entries in this storage backend are annotated with a timestamp, else false. It is assumed that the timestamp matches the one set during the committing transaction.
        Specified by:
        hasTimestamps in interface StoreFeatures
        Returns:

      • getPreferredTimestamps

        public Timestamps getPreferredTimestamps()
        Description copied from interface: StoreFeatures
        If this storage backend supports one particular type of data timestamp/version better than others. For example, HBase server-side TTLs assume row timestamps are in milliseconds; some Cassandra client utils assume timestamps in microseconds. This method should return null if the backend has no preference for a specific timestamp resolution. This method will be ignored by Titan if StoreFeatures.hasTimestamps() is false.
        Specified by:
        getPreferredTimestamps in interface StoreFeatures
        Returns:
        null or a Timestamps enum value

      • hasCellTTL

        public boolean hasCellTTL()
        Description copied from interface: StoreFeatures
        Returns true if this storage backend support time-to-live (TTL) settings for column-value entries. If such a value is provided as a meta-data annotation on the Entry, the entry will disappear from the storage backend after the given amount of time.
        Specified by:
        hasCellTTL in interface StoreFeatures
        Returns:
        true if the storage backend supports TTL, else false

      • hasStoreTTL

        public boolean hasStoreTTL()
        Description copied from interface: StoreFeatures
        Returns true if this storage backend supports time-to-live (TTL) settings on a per-store basis. That means, that entries added to such a store will require after a configured amount of time.
        Specified by:
        hasStoreTTL in interface StoreFeatures
        Returns:

      • hasVisibility

        public boolean hasVisibility()
        Description copied from interface: StoreFeatures
        Returns true if this storage backend supports entry-level visibility by attaching a visibility or authentication token to each column-value entry in the data store and limited retrievals to "visible" entries.
        Specified by:
        hasVisibility in interface StoreFeatures
        Returns:

      • getKeyConsistentTxConfig

        public Configuration getKeyConsistentTxConfig()
        Description copied from interface: StoreFeatures
        Get a transaction configuration that enforces key consistency. This method has undefined behavior when StoreFeatures.isKeyConsistent() is false.
        Specified by:
        getKeyConsistentTxConfig in interface StoreFeatures
        Returns:
        a key-consistent tx config

      • getLocalKeyConsistentTxConfig

        public Configuration getLocalKeyConsistentTxConfig()
        Description copied from interface: StoreFeatures
        Get a transaction configuration that enforces local key consistency. "Local" has flexible meaning depending on the backend implementation. An example is Cassandra's notion of LOCAL_QUORUM, which provides strong consistency among all replicas in the same datacenter as the node handling the request, but not nodes at other datacenters. This method has undefined behavior when StoreFeatures.isKeyConsistent() is false. Backends which don't support the notion of "local" strong consistency may return the same configuration returned by #getKeyConsistencyTxConfig().
        Specified by:
        getLocalKeyConsistentTxConfig in interface StoreFeatures
        Returns:
        a locally (or globally) key-consistent tx config

      • hasLocalKeyPartition

        public boolean hasLocalKeyPartition()
        Specified by:
        hasLocalKeyPartition in interface StoreFeatures
